publication.abstract: Â© 2018 Nature America, Inc., part of of Springer Nature. All rights reserved. Ribosome profiling has been used to predict thousands of short open reading frames (sORFs) in eukaryotic cells, but it suffers from substantial levels of noise. PRICE (https://github.com/erhard-lab/price) is a computational method that models experimental noise to enable researchers to accurately resolve overlapping sORFs and noncanonical translation initiation. We experimentally validated translation using major histocompatibility complex class I (MHC I) peptidomics and observed that sORF-derived peptides efficiently enter the MHC I presentation pathway and thus constitute a substantial fraction of the antigen repertoire.
publication.title: Improved Ribo-seq enables identification of cryptic translation events

summary.description: A method to identify open reading frames (ORF) using Ribosome profiling (Ribo-seq) experiments embedded in a pipeline for data analysis. It is part of GEDI software platform.
summary.name: PRICE
